metadata.Title: CVE-2018-7552 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - untriaged.
metadata.Description:
There is an invalid free in Mapping::DoubleHash::clear in mapping.cpp that leads to a Segmentation fault in sam2p 0.49.4. A crafted input will lead to a denial of service or possibly unspecified other impact. It was discovered that Sam2p incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-7552` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

sam2p - 0.49.2-3+deb8u3build0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sam2p package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.49.2-3+deb8u3build0.16.04.1').
